Articles.Content:
It's the 47th anniversary of the last crewed lunar landing mission of the Apollo program.

Ben Feist (KSP player himself, now a NASA historian and also involved with the 2019 Apollo 11 documentary film), created the Apollo 17 in Real Time website four years ago.

This site, during the anniversary, syncs to real time coverage of the entire mission as it progressed years ago. Every second from 1 minute to launch to splashdown is covered. Video and audio is time-synced. All available photos are there.

Visit https://apollo17.org/ to enjoy.

This summer, an Apollo 11 in Real Time version was created, for the mission's 50th anniversary, that you can enjoy.

And little birdies are telling me that an Apollo 13 version is in the works.
